course_title: Special Topics In Economics: Economics of Education
class_notes: The course will explore how economists examine a variety of issues in K-12 education by illustrating how basic economic principals such as incentives, resource allocation, and market forces can be applied to educational settings. Through discussions of academic papers, the course will also provide a basic grounding in how economists evaluate education policies.
course_description: Course may be repeated for credit when topic varies. Seminar and/or advanced course in selected topics in economics.
sections: Class Nbr: 4213, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: T. Romano, Status: Open
